title.narrative: Second Small and Medium-Sized Enterprise Development Project

description.narrative: Accelerating growth and reducing poverty, income inequality and regional disparity are the overarching goals of the current development paradigm in Bangladesh. Development of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) is envisaged as a key element in this development strategy as noted in the 6th Five-Year Plan (FY2011-2015) of the Government of Bangladesh (GOB). For achieving double digit economic growth, promoting the development of the SME sector is considered critical.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Increase in the number and size of commercially viable SMEs, as well as employment in the SME sector

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
By end of 2021: a. Ratio of SME credit to total loans of the banking sector increased to 25% over the next 4 years (2014 baseline: 20.2%)

description.narrative: Increase in the number and size of commercially viable SMEs, as well as employment in the SME sector

title.narrative: b. SME sector employment increased by 5% over the next 4 years (2014 baseline: 38.1 million people employed)

description.narrative: Increase in the number and size of commercially viable SMEs, as well as employment in the SME sector
